ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: An array of insights regarding in depth human sensory systems.
Detailed information about each of the senses, with applications to multiple different kinds of illusions.
l gained knowledge about how sensory systems work on a cellular level.
I developed a new appreciation for our sensory system through a neuroscience lense. The daily sensory illusions presented during class made it easier to interpret the following lecture material.

I learned a lot about all of the illusions that we come across in real life and the circuitry involved in those systems. I learned a lot of new things about the world we live in, and it is really cool to be able to make those connections now.
I learned about somatosensation
So much information about the physiology of sensory neuroscience pathways, but in such an engaging way!
I developed my knowledge of the human and insect sensory system. It was really interesting to learn how the senses that are used every day function.
This class taught me about the biological pathways through which we perceive and process taste, vision, sounds, touch, and smells.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course did a fantastic job of taking us through every sensory modality and giving us an in-depth understanding of how we and other animals are able to perceive the world. Problem sets were very fair and helpful for understanding course content, exams were also fair, lectures were excellently executed, and discussion sections were extremely useful.
Some of the slides and concepts were well presented and understood while others, like olfaction, what slides that were hard to follow and concepts not well connected.
Amazing course with great professors/ TA's.

I thought the course was great and the material was super interesting. I wish that the scaling of the homeworks was a little bit more evenly distributed. Each homework was out of a different number of points even though some homeworks were harder than others. Other than that I thought that the class grading was largely pretty fair! I think a strength of this course was the demos, it helped keep the classes fun!
Could have spent more time on hearing and less time on vision/olfaction.
This course was fairly graded, had a reasonable workload, was not heavy on exams, and had fun in-class examples. It could be improved by a broader range of office hour times.
Strengths are the professors, TAs, and illusions and class demonstrations.

I really enjoyed all of the demos we did before class! They really helped solidify the material and they were always interesting. I wish we could've spent more time in olfaction, it went by very fast. All of the other senses were really well taught and broken up!
Very well-taught, clear, with a manageable workload, and you learn so much! There are great demos and the TFs and the professor are wonderful.
The material and how it is taught is great. One improvement would be discussion section organization.

I think it would be beneficial if the slides were provided at the beginning of each class so that better note taking can be made of adding the extra information instead of trying to write down everything.
I loved the course and it was well taught.  I think the paper presentations were a little difficult to understand sometimes but maybe a group project would have been cool.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to another student. The professors do a fantastic job at guiding students through content, exams are fair, problem sets are helpful, and the TAs are amazing. We learned an incredible amount of content , but it was delivered in a very clear, non-stressful way.
Yup! Especially neuro, bio, and cogsci majors

Yes, this is a great neuroscience course, and Prof. Clark is great at making lectures engaging but clear. The material you learn is interesting but is not difficult to understand, which makes the class great for those who have some background in neuroscience. The homework/exams are also very reasonable. Even though it is a lecture, because there are group activities interspersed through each of the lectures, the class as a whole feels pretty interactive.
Yes, I enjoyed the course a lot

I would recommend this class to anyone interested in Neuroscience (be it for your major or not) and particularly in how our senses work. The illusions presented during each class were an exciting way to start to learn about each sensory system and to consider how our biology comes into play for illusions.

Yes!! I wish I had taken this course earlier. It's definitely one of the best neuroscience courses offered at Yale. Damon is a fantastic teacher. I think every neuroscience major should take it, but I could imagine it might be challenging without some background in neurobiology.

Yes! This is a great course for neuroscience majors or anyone wanting to learn about the cellular basis of sensory systems. We spent the first half of the semester on the visual system, less time on olfaction, and then the least amount of time on taste, hearing, and touch/pain. Problem sets were only once every two weeks and there were only two exams: a midterm and a final that covered everything past the midterm. I felt that the grading was extremely fair. The professors were always excited to answer questions asked in class by students.
Yes, this is a great elective for the Neuroscience major or if you are interested in learning more about sensory neuroscience.
If they are at all interested in neuroscience, this is a great class to start with! It is very interesting, covers cool material and very digestible!
Yes! It was a great introduction to sensory neuroscience, and the faculty are very responsive. I enjoyed the level of detail in this class and how easy it was applied to our lives.
If you are a neuroscience major, or just interested in started to learn about sensory modalities, I would definitely recommend this course!
I would definitely recommend this class. The course subject is very interesting and the class itself is very engaging when being introduced to all the illusions and different stimuli to the senses.
Yes.  This class is all organized and easily accessible to all levels of prior science knowledge.  It is also very interesting and worthwhile.
